climbs.name: Sweet Dreams
climbs.fa: Tom Slater, Matt Schutz, Grahm Doe

content.description: This is the middle route on the west face of Hawk Tower
content.protection: Three bolts, gear to 3", and slings to tie off knobs.  There is a midway anchor and an anchor on top behind the summit boulder.  Rap from chains on top of Dreaming in Color to mid-station and then to ground if you have a 60m rope.
content.location: Located in the middle of the west face of Hawk Tower

content.description: This is the furthest left route on the west face of Hawk Tower.
content.protection: Full rack, slings to tie off knobs, quick draws for a bolt or two (and for extensions).  Bolted rap anchor on top.
content.location: Left side of west face of Hawk Tower in Dreamscape Area.  Scramble up rock and bushes to the separate start, or start at the "toe" of the rock and traverse left into the left most crack/face line on the left side of the west face.

climbs.name: Dreaming in Color
climbs.fa: Tom Slater, Coby Whitaker, Justin Ross

content.description: A slabby start leads to a long stretch of excellent chicken heads as you work your way around the corner and up the south face. Enjoy the fantastic view and easy 5.3-5.4 finish as you summit Hawk Tower.
content.protection:
Widely spaced bolts and good gear placements lead to two anchors with a chain. A second rappel station is located halfway down for those with shorter ropes, but a 70m should get you all the way to the ground in one rap.

Bring draws, gear to 2" or 3", and even a few slings for the chicken heads. Extend some of the earlier bolts to avoid excessive rope drag.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the west face of Hawk Tower. The approach can be heinous if you stray from the standard "path" (an easy thing to do), but the quality of the route makes up for it.

content.description: A low crux leads above to some "climbing on the brain" and then a very fun juggy roof up to the chains. Extend the 4 clips below the roof to reduce some drag-- it's worth it!
content.location: Left route on the "south face" of Hawk Tower proper. Identified by the large round pocket about 5 feet off the ground and many shining bolts that weave the way up. The start is down and right of "Dreaming in Color" which is on the west face of Hawk Tower

content.description: Head straight up from the 2 bolt anchor mid-face on the west face of Hawk Tower.
content.protection: 7 bolts from the mid-face anchor; nuts, cams, tied-off knobs to get there; 2 bolt anchor at the top with chain
content.location: Start up Sweet Dreams (5.8) from the toe of the west face, and then head straight up and left from the mid-face anchor. Most will want to do the whole climb in a single pitch, from the bottom all the way to the top--no need to belay from the mid-face anchor.
